intro: Scurrula ritozanensis, commonly known as the Ritozanensis scurrula, is a rare and endemic plant species native to a limited geographic region. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae, characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories or rocky crevices. Its unique morphology and restricted distribution make it of interest to botanists and conservationists. Due to habitat loss and limited genetic diversity, it is considered vulnerable to extinction.
